refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Pango supports a flexible architecture where a particular rendering architecture can supply an implementation of fonts. The PangoFont structure represents an abstract rendering-system-independent font. Pango provides routines to list available fonts, and to load a font of a given description.

refsect2.title: PangoFontDescription
refsect2.para: The PangoFontDescription structure represents the description of an ideal font. These structures are used both to list what fonts are available on the system and also for specifying the characteristics of a font to load.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_DESCRIPTION
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontDescription.

refsect2.title: enum PangoStyle
refsect2.para: An enumeration specifying the various slant styles possible for a font.

listitem.simpara: the font is slanted, but in a roman style.
the font is slanted in an italic style.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_STYLE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoStyle.

refsect2.title: enum PangoWeight
refsect2.para: An enumeration specifying the weight (boldness) of a font. This is a numerical value ranging from 100 to 900, but there are some predefined values:

listitem.simpara: a weight intermediate between normal and bold (=600)

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_WEIGHT
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoWeight.

refsect2.title: enum PangoVariant
refsect2.para: An enumeration specifying capitalization variant of the font.

listitem.simpara: A font with the lower case characters replaced by smaller variants of the capital characters.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_VARIANT
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoVariant.

refsect2.title: enum PangoStretch
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { PANGO_STRETCH_ULTRA_CONDENSED, PANGO_STRETCH_EXTRA_CONDENSED, PANGO_STRETCH_CONDENSED, PANGO_STRETCH_SEMI_CONDENSED, PANGO_STRETCH_NORMAL, PANGO_STRETCH_SEMI_EXPANDED, PANGO_STRETCH_EXPANDED, PANGO_STRETCH_EXTRA_EXPANDED, PANGO_STRETCH_ULTRA_EXPANDED } PangoStretch;
refsect2.para: An enumeration specifying the width of the font relative to other designs within a family.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_STRETCH
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoStretch.

refsect2.title: enum PangoFontMask
refsect2.para: The bits in a PangoFontMask correspond to fields in a PangoFontDescription that have been set.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_MASK
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontMask.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new font description structure with all fields unset.

listitem.simpara: the newly allocated PangoFontDescription, which should be freed using pango_font_description_free().

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_copy ()
refsect2.para: Make a copy of a PangoFontDescription.

listitem.simpara: the newly allocated PangoFontDescription, which should be freed with pango_font_description_free().

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_copy_static ()
refsect2.para: Like pango_font_description_copy(), but only a shallow copy is made of the family name and other allocated fields. The result can only be used until desc is modified or freed. This is meant to be used when the copy is only needed temporarily.

listitem.simpara: the newly allocated PangoFontDescription, which should be freed with pango_font_description_free().

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_hash ()
refsect2.para: Computes a hash of a PangoFontDescription structure suitable to be used, for example, as an argument to g_hash_table_new(). The hash value is independent of desc->mask.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_equal ()
refsect2.para: Compares two font descriptions for equality. Two font descriptions are considered equal if the fonts they describe are provably identical. This means that their masks do not have to match, as long as other fields are all the same. (Two font descriptions may result in identical fonts being loaded, but still compare FALSE.)

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the two font descriptions are identical, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees a font description.

refsect2.title: pango_font_descriptions_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees a list of font descriptions from pango_font_map_list_fonts()

listitem.simpara: a pointer to an array of PangoFontDescription, or NULL
number of font descriptions in descs

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_family ()
refsect2.para: Sets the family name field of a font description. The family name represents a family of related font styles, and will resolve to a particular PangoFontFamily. In some uses of PangoFontDescription, it is also possible to use a comma separated list of family names for this field.

listitem.simpara: a string representing the family name.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_family_static ()
refsect2.para: Like pango_font_description_set_family(), except that no copy of family is made. The caller must make sure that the string passed in stays around until desc has been freed or the name is set again. This function can be used if family is a static string such as a C string literal, or if desc is only needed temporarily.

listitem.simpara: a string representing the family name.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_family ()
refsect2.para: Gets the family name field of a font description. See pango_font_description_set_family().

listitem.simpara: the family name field for the font description, or NULL if not previously set. This has the same life-time as the font description itself and should not be freed.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_style ()
refsect2.para: Sets the style field of a PangoFontDescription. The PangoStyle enumeration describes whether the font is slanted and the manner in which it is slanted; it can be either PANGO_STYLE_NORMAL, PANGO_STYLE_ITALIC, or PANGO_STYLE_OBLIQUE. Most fonts will either have a italic style or an oblique style, but not both, and font matching in Pango will match italic specifications with oblique fonts and vice-versa if an exact match is not found.

listitem.simpara: the style for the font description

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_style ()
refsect2.para: Gets the style field of a PangoFontDescription. See pango_font_description_set_style().

listitem.simpara: the style field for the font description. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_variant ()
refsect2.para: Sets the variant field of a font description. The PangoVariant can either be PANGO_VARIANT_NORMAL or PANGO_VARIANT_SMALL_CAPS.

listitem.simpara: the variant type for the font description.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_variant ()
refsect2.para: Gets the variant field of a PangoFontDescription. See pango_font_description_set_variant().

listitem.simpara: the variant field for the font description. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_weight ()
refsect2.para: Sets the weight field of a font description. The weight field specifies how bold or light the font should be. In addition to the values of the PangoWeight enumeration, other intermediate numeric values are possible.

listitem.simpara: the weight for the font description.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_weight ()
refsect2.para: Gets the weight field of a font description. See pango_font_description_set_weight().

listitem.simpara: the weight field for the font description. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_stretch ()
refsect2.para: Sets the stretch field of a font description. The stretch field specifies how narrow or wide the font should be.

listitem.simpara: the stretch for the font description

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_stretch ()
refsect2.para: Gets the stretch field of a font description. See pango_font_description_set_stretch().

listitem.simpara: the stretch field for the font description. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the size field of a font description in fractional points. This is mutually exclusive with pango_font_description_set_absolute_size().

listitem.simpara: the size of the font in points, scaled by PANGO_SCALE. (That is, a size value of 10 * PANGO_SCALE is a 10 point font. The conversion factor between points and device units depends on system configuration and the output device. For screen display, a logical DPI of 96 is common, in which case a 10 point font corresponds to a 10 * (96 / 72) = 13.3 pixel font. Use pango_font_description_set_absolute_size() if you need a particular size in device units.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_size ()
refsect2.para: Gets the size field of a font description. See pango_font_description_set_size().

listitem.simpara: the size field for the font description in points or device units. You must call pango_font_description_get_size_is_absolute() to find out which is the case. Returns 0 if the size field has not previously been set or it has been set to 0 explicitly. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_absolute_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the size field of a font description, in device units. This is mutually exclusive with pango_font_description_set_size() which sets the font size in points.

listitem.simpara: the new size, in Pango units. There are PANGO_SCALE Pango units in one device unit. For an output backend where a device unit is a pixel, a size value of 10 * PANGO_SCALE gives a 10 pixel font.

refsect2.para: Since 1.8

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_size_is_absolute ()
refsect2.para: Determines whether the size of the font is in points (not absolute) or device units (absolute). See pango_font_description_set_size() and pango_font_description_set_absolute_size().

listitem.simpara: whether the size for the font description is in points or device units. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the size field of the font description was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.para: Since 1.8

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_set_gravity ()
refsect2.para: Sets the gravity field of a font description. The gravity field specifies how the glyphs should be rotated. If gravity is PANGO_GRAVITY_AUTO, this actually unsets the gravity mask on the font description.
This function is seldom useful to the user. Gravity should normally be set on a PangoContext.

listitem.simpara: the gravity for the font description.

refsect2.para: Since 1.16

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_gravity ()
refsect2.para: Gets the gravity field of a font description. See pango_font_description_set_gravity().

listitem.simpara: the gravity field for the font description. Use pango_font_description_get_set_fields() to find out if the field was explicitly set or not.

refsect2.para: Since 1.16

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_get_set_fields ()
refsect2.para: Determines which fields in a font description have been set.

listitem.simpara: a bitmask with bits set corresponding to the fields in desc that have been set.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_unset_fields ()
refsect2.para: Unsets some of the fields in a PangoFontDescription. The unset fields will get back to their default values.

listitem.simpara: bitmask of fields in the desc to unset.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_merge ()
refsect2.para: Merges the fields that are set in desc_to_merge into the fields in desc. If replace_existing is FALSE, only fields in desc that are not already set are affected. If TRUE, then fields that are already set will be replaced as well.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE, replace fields in desc with the corresponding values from desc_to_merge, even if they are already exist.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_merge_static ()
refsect2.para: Like pango_font_description_merge(), but only a shallow copy is made of the family name and other allocated fields. desc can only be used until desc_to_merge is modified or freed. This is meant to be used when the merged font description is only needed temporarily.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE, replace fields in desc with the corresponding values from desc_to_merge, even if they are already exist.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_better_match ()
refsect2.para: Determines if the style attributes of new_match are a closer match for desc than old_match, or if old_match is NULL, determines if new_match is a match at all. Approximate matching is done for weight and style; other attributes must match exactly.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if new_match is a better match

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new font description from a string representation in the form "[FAMILY-LIST] [STYLE-OPTIONS] [SIZE]", where FAMILY-LIST is a comma separated list of families optionally terminated by a comma, STYLE_OPTIONS is a whitespace separated list of words where each WORD describes one of style, variant, weight, stretch, or gravity, and SIZE is a decimal number (size in points) or optionally followed by the unit modifier "px" for absolute size. Any one of the options may be absent. If FAMILY-LIST is absent, then the family_name field of the resulting font description will be initialized to NULL. If STYLE-OPTIONS is missing, then all style options will be set to the default values. If SIZE is missing, the size in the resulting font description will be set to 0.

listitem.simpara: string representation of a font description.

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Creates a string representation of a font description. See pango_font_description_from_string() for a description of the format of the string representation. The family list in the string description will only have a terminating comma if the last word of the list is a valid style option.

listitem.simpara: a new string that must be freed with g_free().

refsect2.title: pango_font_description_to_filename ()
refsect2.para: Creates a filename representation of a font description. The filename is identical to the result from calling pango_font_description_to_string(), but with underscores instead of characters that are untypical in filenames, and in lower case only.

listitem.simpara: a new string that must be freed with g_free().

refsect2.title: PangoFontMetrics
refsect2.para: A PangoFontMetrics structure holds the overall metric information for a font (possibly restricted to a script). The fields of this structure are private to implementations of a font backend. See the documentation of the corresponding getters for documentation of their meaning.

listitem.simpara: reference count. Used internally. See pango_font_metrics_ref() and pango_font_metrics_unref().
the distance from the baseline to the highest point of the glyphs of the font. This is positive in practically all fonts.
the distance from the baseline to the lowest point of the glyphs of the font. This is positive in practically all fonts.
approximate average width of the regular glyphs of the font.
approximate average width of the glyphs for digits of the font.
position of the underline. This is normally negative.
position of the strikethrough line. This is normally positive.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_METRICS
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontMetrics.

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of a font metrics structure by one.

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of a font metrics structure by one. If the result is zero, frees the structure and any associated memory.

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_ascent ()
refsect2.para: Gets the ascent from a font metrics structure. The ascent is the distance from the baseline to the logical top of a line of text. (The logical top may be above or below the top of the actual drawn ink. It is necessary to lay out the text to figure where the ink will be.)

listitem.simpara: the ascent, in Pango units. (1 point == PANGO_SCALE Pango units.)

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_descent ()
refsect2.para: Gets the descent from a font metrics structure. The descent is the distance from the baseline to the logical bottom of a line of text. (The logical bottom may be above or below the bottom of the actual drawn ink. It is necessary to lay out the text to figure where the ink will be.)

listitem.simpara: the descent, in Pango units. (1 point == PANGO_SCALE Pango units.)

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_approximate_char_width ()
refsect2.para: Gets the approximate character width for a font metrics structure. This is merely a representative value useful, for example, for determining the initial size for a window. Actual characters in text will be wider and narrower than this.

listitem.simpara: the character width, in Pango units. (1 point == PANGO_SCALE Pango units.)

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_approximate_digit_width ()
refsect2.para: Gets the approximate digit width for a font metrics structure. This is merely a representative value useful, for example, for determining the initial size for a window. Actual digits in text can be wider or narrower than this, though this value is generally somewhat more accurate than the result of pango_font_metrics_get_approximate_char_width() for digits.

listitem.simpara: the digit width, in Pango units. (1 point == PANGO_SCALE Pango units.)

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_underline_thickness ()
refsect2.para: Gets the suggested thickness to draw for the underline.

listitem.simpara: the suggested underline thickness, in Pango units.

refsect2.para: Since 1.6

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_underline_position ()
refsect2.para: Gets the suggested position to draw the underline. The value returned is the distance above the baseline of the top of the underline. Since most fonts have underline positions beneath the baseline, this value is typically negative.

listitem.simpara: the suggested underline position, in Pango units.

refsect2.para: Since 1.6

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_strikethrough_thickness ()
refsect2.para: Gets the suggested thickness to draw for the strikethrough.

listitem.simpara: the suggested strikethrough thickness, in Pango units.

refsect2.para: Since 1.6

refsect2.title: pango_font_metrics_get_strikethrough_position ()
refsect2.para: Gets the suggested position to draw the strikethrough. The value returned is the distance above the baseline of the top of the strikethrough.

listitem.simpara: the suggested strikethrough position, in Pango units.

refsect2.para: Since 1.6

refsect2.title: PangoFont
refsect2.para: The PangoFont structure is used to represent a font in a rendering-system-independent matter. To create an implementation of a PangoFont, the rendering-system specific code should allocate a larger structure that contains a nested PangoFont, fill in the klass member of the nested PangoFont with a pointer to a appropriate PangoFontClass, then call pango_font_init() on the structure.
The PangoFont structure contains one member which the implementation fills in.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFont.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT()
refsect2.para: Casts a GObject to a PangoFont.

refsect2.title: PANGO_IS_FONT()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if object is a PangoFont.

refsect2.title: pango_font_find_shaper ()
refsect2.para: Finds the best matching shaper for a font for a particular language tag and character point.

refsect2.title: pango_font_describe ()
refsect2.para: Returns a description of the font, with font size set in points. Use pango_font_describe_with_absolute_size() if you want the font size in device units.

refsect2.title: pango_font_describe_with_absolute_size ()
refsect2.para: Returns a description of the font, with absolute font size set (in device units). Use pango_font_describe() if you want the font size in points.
Since 1.14

refsect2.title: pango_font_get_coverage ()
refsect2.para: Computes the coverage map for a given font and language tag.

refsect2.title: pango_font_get_glyph_extents ()
refsect2.programlisting: void pango_font_get_glyph_extents (PangoFont *font, PangoGlyph glyph, PangoRectangle *ink_rect, PangoRectangle *logical_rect);
refsect2.para: Gets the logical and ink extents of a glyph within a font. The coordinate system for each rectangle has its origin at the base line and horizontal origin of the character with increasing coordinates extending to the right and down. The macros PANGO_ASCENT(), PANGO_DESCENT(), PANGO_LBEARING(), and PANGO_RBEARING() can be used to convert from the extents rectangle to more traditional font metrics. The units of the rectangles are in 1/PANGO_SCALE of a device unit.

listitem.simpara: rectangle used to store the extents of the glyph as drawn or NULL to indicate that the result is not needed.
rectangle used to store the logical extents of the glyph or NULL to indicate that the result is not needed.

refsect2.title: pango_font_get_metrics ()
refsect2.para: Gets overall metric information for a font. Since the metrics may be substantially different for different scripts, a language tag can be provided to indicate that the metrics should be retrieved that correspond to the script(s) used by that language.

listitem.simpara: language tag used to determine which script to get the metrics for, or NULL to indicate to get the metrics for the entire font.
a PangoFontMetrics object. The caller must call pango_font_metrics_unref() when finished using the object.

refsect2.title: pango_font_get_font_map ()
refsect2.para: Gets the font map for which the font was created.
Since 1.10

refsect2.title: PangoFontFamily
refsect2.para: The PangoFontFamily structure is used to represent a family of related font faces. The faces in a family share a common design, but differ in slant, weight, width and other aspects.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_FAMILY
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontFamily.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT_FAMILY()
refsect2.para: Casts a GObject to a PangoFontFamily.

refsect2.title: PANGO_IS_FONT_FAMILY()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if object is a PangoFontFamily.

refsect2.title: pango_font_family_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of the family. The name is unique among all fonts for the font backend and can be used in a PangoFontDescription to specify that a face from this family is desired.

listitem.simpara: the name of the family. This string is owned by the family object and must not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: pango_font_family_is_monospace ()
refsect2.para: A monospace font is a font designed for text display where the the characters form a regular grid. For Western languages this would mean that the advance width of all characters are the same, but this categorization also includes Asian fonts which include double-width characters: characters that occupy two grid cells. g_unichar_iswide() returns a result that indicates whether a character is typically double-width in a monospace font.

The best way to find out the grid-cell size is to call pango_font_metrics_get_approximate_digit_width(), since the results of pango_font_metrics_get_approximate_char_width() may be affected by double-width characters.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the family is monospace.

refsect2.para: Since 1.4

refsect2.title: pango_font_family_list_faces ()
refsect2.para: Lists the different font faces that make up family. The faces in a family share a common design, but differ in slant, weight, width and other aspects.

listitem.simpara: location to store an array of pointers to PangoFontFace objects, or NULL. This array should be freed with g_free() when it is no longer needed.
location to store number of elements in faces.

refsect2.title: PangoFontFace
refsect2.para: The PangoFontFace structure is used to represent a group of fonts with the same family, slant, weight, width, but varying sizes.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_FACE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontFace.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT_FACE()
refsect2.para: Casts a GObject to a PangoFontFace.

refsect2.title: PANGO_IS_FONT_FACE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if object is a PangoFontFace.

refsect2.title: pango_font_face_get_face_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets a name representing the style of this face among the different faces in the PangoFontFamily for the face. This name is unique among all faces in the family and is suitable for displaying to users.

listitem.simpara: the face name for the face. This string is owned by the face object and must not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: pango_font_face_list_sizes ()
refsect2.para: List the available sizes for a font. This is only applicable to bitmap fonts. For scalable fonts, stores NULL at the location pointed to by sizes and 0 at the location pointed to by n_sizes. The sizes returned are in Pango units and are sorted in ascending order.

listitem.simpara: location to store a pointer to an array of int. This array should be freed with g_free().
location to store the number of elements in sizes

refsect2.para: Since 1.4

refsect2.title: pango_font_face_describe ()
refsect2.para: Returns the family, style, variant, weight and stretch of a PangoFontFace. The size field of the resulting font description will be unset.

listitem.simpara: a newly-created PangoFontDescription structure holding the description of the face. Use pango_font_description_free() to free the result.

refsect2.title: pango_font_face_is_synthesized ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether a PangoFontFace is synthesized by the underlying font rendering engine from another face, perhaps by shearing, emboldening, or lightening it.
Since 1.18

refsect2.title: PangoFontMap
refsect2.para: The PangoFontMap represents the set of fonts available for a particular rendering system. This is a virtual object with implementations being specific to particular rendering systems. To create an implementation of a PangoFontMap, the rendering-system specific code should allocate a larger structure that contains a nested PangoFontMap, fill in the klass member of the nested PangoFontMap with a pointer to a appropriate PangoFontMapClass, then call pango_font_map_init() on the structure.
The PangoFontMap structure contains one member which the implementation fills in.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONT_MAP
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontMap.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT_MAP()
refsect2.para: Casts a GObject to a PangoFontMap.

refsect2.title: PANGO_IS_FONT_MAP()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if object is a PangoFontMap.

refsect2.title: PangoFontMapClass
refsect2.para: The PangoFontMapClass structure holds the virtual functions for a particular PangoFontMap implementation.

listitem.simpara: a function to load a font with a given description. See pango_font_map_load_font().
A function to list available font families. See pango_font_map_list_families().
a function to load a fontset with a given given description suitable for a particular language. See pango_font_map_load_fontset().
the type of rendering-system-dependent engines that can handle fonts of this fonts loaded with this fontmap.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT_MAP_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Casts a GObject to a PangoFontMapClass.

refsect2.title: PANGO_IS_FONT_MAP_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if klass is a subtype of PangoFontMapClass.

refsect2.title: PANGO_FONT_MAP_GET_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Returns the type of a PangoFontMap.

refsect2.title: pango_font_map_load_font ()
refsect2.para: Load the font in the fontmap that is the closest match for desc.

listitem.simpara: the PangoContext the font will be used with
a PangoFontDescription describing the font to load
the font loaded, or NULL if no font matched.

refsect2.title: pango_font_map_load_fontset ()
refsect2.programlisting: PangoFontset* pango_font_map_load_fontset (PangoFontMap *fontmap, PangoContext *context, const PangoFontDescription *desc, PangoLanguage *language);
refsect2.para: Load a set of fonts in the fontmap that can be used to render a font matching desc.

listitem.simpara: the PangoContext the font will be used with
a PangoFontDescription describing the font to load
a PangoLanguage the fonts will be used for
the fontset, or NULL if no font matched.

refsect2.title: pango_font_map_list_families ()
refsect2.para: List all families for a fontmap.

listitem.simpara: location to store a pointer to an array of PangoFontFamily *. This array should be freed with g_free().
location to store the number of elements in families

refsect2.title: pango_font_map_get_shape_engine_type ()
refsect2.para: Returns the render ID for shape engines for this fontmap. See the render_type field of PangoEngineInfo.

listitem.simpara: the ID string for shape engines for this fontmap. Owned by Pango, should not be modified or freed.

refsect2.para: Since 1.4

refsect2.title: PangoFontset
refsect2.para: A PangoFontset represents a set of PangoFont to use when rendering text. It is the result of resolving a PangoFontDescription against a particular PangoContext. It has operations for finding the component font for a particular Unicode character, and for finding a composite set of metrics for the entire fontset.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONTSET
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontset.

refsect2.title: PangoFontsetClass
refsect2.para: The PangoFontsetClass structure holds the virtual functions for a particular PangoFontset implementation.

listitem.simpara: a function to get the font in the fontset that contains the best glyph for the given Unicode character; see pango_fontset_get_font().
a function to get overall metric information for the fonts in the fontset; see pango_fontset_get_metrics().
a function to get the language of the fontset.
a function to loop over the fonts in the fontset. See pango_fontset_foreach().

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_get_font ()
refsect2.para: Returns the font in the fontset that contains the best glyph for the Unicode character wc.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFont. The caller must call g_object_unref when finished with the font.

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_get_metrics ()
refsect2.para: Get overall metric information for the fonts in the fontset.

listitem.simpara: a PangoFontMetrics object. The caller must call pango_font_metrics_unref() when finished using the object.

refsect2.title: PangoFontsetForeachFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by pango_fontset_foreach() when enumerating the fonts in a fontset.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE, stop iteration and return immediately.

refsect2.para: Since 1.4

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_foreach ()
refsect2.para: Iterates through all the fonts in a fontset, calling func for each one. If func returns TRUE, that stops the iteration.

listitem.simpara: data to pass to the callback function

refsect2.para: Since 1.4

refsect2.title: PangoFontsetSimple
refsect2.para: PangoFontsetSimple is a implementation of the abstract PangoFontset base class in terms of an array of fonts, which the creator provides when constructing the PangoFontsetSimple.

refsect2.title: PANGO_TYPE_FONTSET_SIMPLE
refsect2.para: The GObject type for PangoFontsetSimple.

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_simple_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new PangoFontsetSimple for the given language.

listitem.simpara: the newly allocated PangoFontsetSimple, which should be freed with g_object_unref().

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_simple_append ()
refsect2.para: Adds a font to the fontset.

refsect2.title: pango_fontset_simple_size ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of fonts in the fontset.
